unnormalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices I can easily incorporate into my daily life?**
normalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices I can easily incorporate into my daily life?**

unnormalised: Okay, so you're looking to bring a little yoga into your everyday hustle? Awesome! Trust me, even small doses can make a big difference. I started with just 15 minutes a day and felt amazing.
normalised: Okay, so you're looking to bring a little yoga into your everyday hustle? Awesome! Trust me, even small doses can make a big difference. I started with just fifteen minutes a day and felt amazing.

unnormalised: First off, Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar) are a classic. Do a set of 5-10 repetitions at 07:00 hrs; it's a great way to wake up your body and mind, especially before that first cup of chai. My grandmother, Dadi Kamala, swears by it!
normalised: First off, Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar) are a classic. Do a set of five to ten repetitions at seven o'clock; it's a great way to wake up your body and mind, especially before that first cup of chai. My grandmother, Dadi Kamala, swears by it!

unnormalised: Another easy one is breathing exercises, specifically Pranayama. Kapalabhati (skull shining breath) is energizing, and Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is calming. Try doing 5 minutes of each at lunchtime, maybe after a quick dal-chawal. I learned these at a yoga retreat in Rishikesh last year.
normalised: Another easy one is breathing exercises, specifically Pranayama. Kapalabhati (skull shining breath) is energizing, and Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing) is calming. Try doing five minutes of each at lunchtime, maybe after a quick dal-chawal. I learned these at a yoga retreat in Rishikesh last year.

unnormalised: Then, for posture, try incorporating Tadasana (Mountain Pose) throughout your day. While waiting for the bus on MG Road or standing in the queue at the bank, focus on your alignment. It sounds simple, but it really helps improve posture and body awareness.
normalised: Then, for posture, try incorporating Tadasana (Mountain Pose) throughout your day. While waiting for the bus on M G Road or standing in the queue at the bank, focus on your alignment. It sounds simple, but it really helps improve posture and body awareness.

unnormalised: Finally, don't underestimate the power of Savasana (Corpse Pose) at 22:00 hrs before bed. Just lie down and relax for 5-10 minutes. It's the perfect way to de-stress after a long day of work. I still remember my first Savasana experience on 26/01/2015!
normalised: Finally, don't underestimate the power of Savasana (Corpse Pose) at twenty two o'clock before bed. Just lie down and relax for five to ten minutes. It's the perfect way to de-stress after a long day of work. I still remember my first Savasana experience on twenty sixth january two thousand and fifteen!

unnormalised: Remember, consistency is key. Start small and gradually increase the duration as you get comfortable. Namaste!
normalised: Remember, consistency is key. Start small and gradually increase the duration as you get comfortable. Namaste!
